headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; DEATHS IN BROOKLYN. POLICE COURT. ACCIDENT.

docs.lead_paragraph: DEATHS IN BROOKLYN--From the Health Physician's report for the week ending April 9, we lear that there were, during the weeK, 64 deaths; 31 of them were males and 33 females. Of the whole number, 26 were adults and 38 children.
docs.snippet: DEATHS IN BROOKLYN--From the Health Physician's report for the week ending April 9, we lear that there were, during the weeK, 64 deaths; 31 of them were males and 33 females. Of the whole number, 26 were adults and 38 children.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; THE NEW CLOCK FOR TIIE CITY HALL.- THE RECENT GAMBLING OPERATION--ANOTHER CHARGE AND REARREST OF THE GAMBLERS. THE STRIKE MOVEMENT.--THE COOPERS. docs.lead_paragraph: THE NEW CLOCK FOR TIIE CITY HALL.--A large number of citizens visited the Exchange yesterday, to inspect the new Clock now on exhibition there, and intended for the turret of the City Hall. This clock is the workmanship of Messrs. SHERRY BYRAM, of Sag Harhor, Long Island. Our readers may be interested in the following description:

headline.main: NEW-ORLEANS.; Sabbath in New-Orleans--Slaves that would not be free--Carondelet Canal--Local Politics, and other matters as seen by a Louisianian. To the Editor of the N. Y. Daily Times:

docs.lead_paragraph: This is Sunday. It is a charming day. The light broke over the far eastern lakes and prairies of our State this morning, with that beauty and melting tenderness of Spring blushing into Summer. The coast looks beautiful with its green fields, shrubbery, and forest trees, dotted here and there with pretty villas and mansions, while the air is laden with the grateful perfumes of the orange blossom. The Mississippi is very high,

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE.; ARRIVAL OF THE EUROPA. Reported Adjustment between Russia and Turkey. Emancipation of Spanish Slaves. Arrival of the Madiai at Marscilles. Cotton Market Tame--Flour and Grain Firm. TURKEY. Reported Adjustment of the Difficulties. ENGLAND. FRANCE. The Turkish Question, &c. Arrival of the Madini at Marseilles. French Commerce. SPAIN. Emancipation of Slaves, &c. PORTUGAL. SWEDEN. DENMARK. GERMANY. ITALY. More Executions in Milan. LATEST INTELLICENCE. Liverpool Markets. Freights at Liverpool. London Markets. American Securities. Bank of England. Havre Market. LATEST.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Royal Mail steamship Europa, Captain LOTT, arrived at this port on Saturday, from Liverpool, whence she brings dates to the 26th March; having made the passage in a little better than fourteen days. The 25th being Good Friday was kept as a strict holiday in England. Our market reports from Liverpool, London, and elsewhere are therefore no later than to the evening of Thursday, 24th.

headline.main: NOTICES OF NEW PUBLICATIONS.; The April Magazines.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Poetical Works of Thomas Gray; edited by Prof. HENRY REED. Every craft knows its own difficulties. That which has most seriously perplexed book-makers is the expansion of the writings of GRAY into the dimensions of a decent volume: a problem which for a hundred years has defied ingenuity. BNTLEY tried his hand at it first, in 1753.

docs.lead_paragraph: NIBLO's GARDEN.--We are glad to announce that the opera of the " Favorita " will be produced positively this evening. Signor SALVI is perfectly restored to health. At the rehearsal yesterday he sang with more vigor and brilliancy than ever.
docs.snippet: NIBLO's GARDEN.--We are glad to announce that the opera of the " Favorita " will be produced positively this evening. Signor SALVI is perfectly restored to health. At the rehearsal yesterday he sang with more vigor and brilliancy than ever.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Mrs. Sanderson, of Lancaster, Mass., a few days since, while engaged in her domestics duties, had occasion to pour into a a pail or tub, ?? quantity of boiling water, Being called to leave the room immediately after, she left the vessel uncovered.

docs.lead_paragraph: J. WATSON WEBB entertains the private circle of subscribers to the Courier and Enquirer, about once a month, with a repetition of the personal abuse of me, with which he has been in the habit of consoling himself since the Winter of 1851, for my refusal to aid his enHeavors then to be nominated by the Whigs of the Legislature of this State, as their Candidate for United States Senator.
